meta.description: A manufacturing company needs to transport 1800 units of products from the warehouse to three different sales points. The company has four transportation options to choose from: trucks, vans, motorcycles, and electric vehicles. Due to the high energy consumption of vans and electric vehicles, the company wants to choose only one of these two transportation options. Trucks generate 100 units of pollution per trip, vans generate 50 units of pollution, motorcycles generate 10 units of pollution, and electric vehicles generate 0 units of pollution. The total pollution generated by all trips must not exceed 2000 units. Trucks must be used at least 10 times. Trucks, vans, motorcycles, and electric vehicles can carry 100 units, 80 units, 40 units, and 60 units of products per trip, respectively. The company needs to ensure that the total quantity of products transported is at least 1800 units.

vars.name: trips
vars.description: Number of trips for each vehicle type

vars.name: use_van_or_ev
vars.description: Binary variable to choose between van and electric vehicle

objective.name: minimize_pollution
objective.expr: quicksum(pollution[v] * trips[v] for v in Vehicles)

constraints.name: total_units
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(capacity[v] * trips[v] for v in Vehicles)
constraints.description: Ensure at least 1800 units are transported

constraints.name: pollution_limit
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(pollution[v] * trips[v] for v in Vehicles)
constraints.description: Total pollution must not exceed 2000 units

constraints.name: trucks_minimum
constraints.description: Trucks must be used at least 10 times

constraints.name: van_or_ev_choice
constraints.description: Choose only one between vans and electric vehicles

constraints.name: ev_or_van_choice
constraints.description: Choose only one between electric vehicles and vans
